title: [Large-scale] Short-Intensive Computer-Assisted Learning (CAL) Course for Dermatological Diagnosis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and dermatology clinical experience
context.additional_context: Customized Computer-Assisted Learning (CAL) tools for advanced learners, incorporating diagnostic case-based problem-solving training.

learning_goals: Learners can identify clinical features of over 20 major skin diseases with 90% accuracy via a Computer-Assisted Learning (CAL) program.
Learners can analyze complex cases presented in CAL simulations and establish appropriate diagnostic and treatment plans with over 80% accuracy.
Learners demonstrate a 15% or greater improvement in knowledge application skills in post-course online formative assessments compared to baseline.

resources: Dermatology CAL (Computer-Assisted Learning) Dedicated Software License

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
